intro: Achras staminodella, commonly known as the red-fruit achiote, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms, and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into orange-red, fleshy fruits containing numerous seeds. Its fruit is often used in traditional medicine and as a natural dye due to its rich pigment content. The plant thrives in warm, humid climates and is well adapted to coastal and lowland environments.
